edu.rit.pj2

Interface Vbl

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BitSet32Vbl, BitSet32Vbl.Intersection, BitSet32Vbl.MaxSize, BitSet32Vbl.MinSize, BitSet32Vbl.Union, BitSet64Vbl, BitSet64Vbl.Intersection, BitSet64Vbl.MaxSize, BitSet64Vbl.MinSize, BitSet64Vbl.Union, BitSetVbl, BitSetVbl.Intersection, BitSetVbl.MaxSize, BitSetVbl.MinSize, BitSetVbl.Union, BooleanVbl, BooleanVbl.And, BooleanVbl.Or, BooleanVbl.Xor, ByteVbl, ByteVbl.And, ByteVbl.Max, ByteVbl.Min, ByteVbl.Or, ByteVbl.Sum, ByteVbl.Xor, CharVbl, Combiner, DoubleHistogramVbl, DoubleVbl, DoubleVbl.Max, DoubleVbl.Mean, DoubleVbl.Min, DoubleVbl.Sum, FloatHistogramVbl, FloatVbl, FloatVbl.Max, FloatVbl.Mean, FloatVbl.Min, FloatVbl.Sum, Histogram, HistogramVbl, IntHistogramVbl, IntVbl, IntVbl.And, IntVbl.Max, IntVbl.Min, IntVbl.Or, IntVbl.Sum, IntVbl.Xor, LongHistogramVbl, LongVbl, LongVbl.And, LongVbl.Max, LongVbl.Min, LongVbl.Or, LongVbl.Sum, LongVbl.Xor, ObjectHistogramVbl, ShortVbl, ShortVbl.And, ShortVbl.Max, ShortVbl.Min, ShortVbl.Or, ShortVbl.Sum, ShortVbl.Xor, StringVbl

    public interface Vbl
extends Cloneable
    Interface Vbl specifies the interface for a variable shared by multiple threads executing a ParallelStatement. Subclasses provide shared variables of each primitive type. For a shared variable of a nonprimitive type, define a subclass with the appropriate fields that implements interface Vbl.

    The shared variable classes support the parallel reduction pattern. Each thread creates a thread-local copy of the shared variable by calling the threadLocal() method of class Loop or the threadLocal() method of class Section. Each thread performs operations on its own copy, without needing to synchronize with the other threads. At the end of the parallel statement, the thread-local copies are automatically reduced together, and the result is stored in the original shared variable. The reduction is performed by the shared variable's reduce() method.

    Interface Vbl extends interface Cloneable. A subclass must implement the clone() method to create a deep copy of the shared variable. If this is not done, the reduction pattern will not work.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Object clone()
      Create a clone of this shared variable.
      void reduce(Vbl vbl)
      Reduce the given shared variable into this shared variable.
      void set(Vbl vbl)
      Set this shared variable to the given shared variable.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        Object clone()
        Create a clone of this shared variable. The clone must be a deep copy of this shared variable.
        Returns:
        The cloned object.

      • set

        void set(Vbl vbl)
        Set this shared variable to the given shared variable. This variable must be set to a deep copy of the given variable.
        Parameters:
        vbl - Shared variable.
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the class of vbl is not compatible with the class of this shared variable.

      • reduce

        void reduce(Vbl vbl)
        Reduce the given shared variable into this shared variable. The two variables are combined together, and the result is stored in this shared variable. The reduce() method does not need to be multiple thread safe (thread synchronization is handled by the caller).
        Parameters:
        vbl - Shared variable.
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the class of vbl is not compatible with the class of this shared variable.
